required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Observation of Ciprofol for Anesthesia Induction
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Observation of Ciprofol for Anesthesia Induction in the Elderly Undergoing Elective Non-cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effect of ciprofol anesthesia Induction on hemodynamics in elderly patients undergoing elective noncardiac surgery，a prospective, randomized, controlled trial.

detailed_description.textblock: 90 elderly patients undergoing noncardiac surgery were randomly divided into propofol group and ciprofol group, who were given propofol 1 ~ 2mg/kg or ciprofol 0.2-0.5mg/kg during anesthesia induction respectively. Systolic blood pressure (SBP), diastolic blood pressure (DBP), heart rate (HR) and BIS values at various time points during anesthesia induction were collected. At the same time, rates of injection pain, muscle fasciculation, arrhythmia, cough and perioperative hepatic and renal functions were compared between the two groups. The primary outcomes were the fluctuations in hemodynamic parameters during induction. The secondary outcome were adverse reactions, BIS values and changes of hepatic and renal functions during induction.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of drug administration to 30 minutes after intubation
primary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) during anesthesia induction

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of drug administration to 30 minutes after intubation
primary_outcome.description: Diastolic blood pressure(DBP) during anesthesia induction

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of drug administration to 30 minutes after intubation

secondary_outcome.description: injection pain from propofol or ciprofol intravenous injection
muscle fasciculation induced by propofol or ciprofol intravenous induction
arrhythmia induced by propofol or ciprofol intravenous induction

secondary_outcome.measure: perioperative hepatic function: Aspartate Aminotransferase ( AST)
perioperative hepatic function: Alanine Aminotransferase ( ALT)

arm_group.description: According to grouping，patients were premeditated with injection of Propofol 1-2mg / kg IV . If BIS is ≤ 60, Tracheal intubation was facilitated with cisatracurium 0.2mg/kg a IV and sufentanil 0.3 μ g / kg IV. if BIS is >60, propofol 0.5mg/kg was titrated intravenously, with an interval of more than 1min until the BIS is ≤ 60，and intubation was performed after cisatracurium and sufentanil injected .General anesthesia was maintained with Propofol and remifentanil.

According to grouping，patients were premeditated with injection of ciprofol 0.2-0.5mg/kg IV. If BIS is ≤ 60, Tracheal intubation was facilitated with cisatracurium 0.2mg/kg a IV and sufentanil 0.3 μ g / kg IV. if BIS is >60, ciprofol 0.1mg/kg was titrated intravenously, with an interval of more than 1min until the BIS is ≤ 60，and intubation was performed after cisatracurium and sufentanil injected .General anesthesia was maintained with Propofol and remifentanil in both groups.

intervention.description: Propofol 1-2mg / kg was for anesthesia induction. Propofol is a hypnotic agent that is used as an induction agent and as a maintenance anaesthetic delivered by continuous i.v. infusion or intermittent i.v. bolus.

Ciprofol 0.2～0.5mg/kg was for anesthesia induction. Ciprofol is an intravenous sedative-hypnotic and a short-acting GABAA receptor agonist. It activates GABAergic neurons by enhancing chloride ion influx. It is used for anesthetic induction and maintenance agents include rapid induction of general anesthesia, rapid return of consciousness, minimal residual effects on the central nervous system and less injection pain.

overall_official.affiliation: Qian fo shan hospitial of shan dong province, China
